title: Elementary Mathematics Instruction Competency Enhancement Course via Technology-Supported Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary mathematics curricula and experience in using digital tools
context.additional_context: Process of in-service elementary school teachers designing and implementing mathematical problem-solving projects in a technology-supported collaborative environment, with a focus on PBL instruction utilizing collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.) and educational apps (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.) in a BYOD setting

learning_goals: Learners design and implement at least one elementary mathematics problem-solving project applying a technology-supported collaborative learning model.
Learners improve project deliverables by exchanging feedback with peer teachers using digital collaboration tools.
Practicing a help-seeking attitude by recognizing difficulties in the learning process and actively requesting assistance
Propose at least three strategies to enhance academic engagement in the PBL-based instructional design process
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
